--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2024/0615 b) Date of Occurrence: 31/08/2023
c) Installation Details: Venom Attack - AC-9857-832 at
Sector South Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Pneumatic b) Date Component 07/09/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Pneumatic Starter d) Main Assembly: Pylon-C
e) Nomenclature: Pneumatic Starter Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Modified
g) Part No.: PN-3929-N5 h) Sl No.: SN-5373-184
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 30/03/2023 l) Date of Removal: 04/09/2023
Pg No: 147 Ln No: 3 Pg No: 70 Ln No: 7
m) Manufacturing Agency: Epsilon Avionics Ltd n) Date, Month & Year September 2019
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 108 Hrs / 318 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Critical
b) Defect Observed: Pneumatic starter motor overheat. Malfunction reported by flight crew.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Contamination ingress through damaged seal assembly
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pneumatic Starter component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Revise maintenance procedure to include additional verification steps
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Enhance operator training on proper usage procedures
d) Attributable Code: NFF - No Failure Found
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 07/10/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Manufacturing quality documentation reviewed. No deviations noted. Concur with investigation findings.
Date: 08/10/2023 Signature: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions.
Date: 08/10/2023 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval.
Date: 13/10/2023 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 16/10/2023 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
